title: Increase Mather
summary: Increase Mather (/ˈmæðər/; June 21, 1639 Old Style[1] – August 23, 1723 Old Style) was an American Puritan clergyman in the Massachusetts Bay Colony and president of Harvard College for twenty years (1681–1701).[2] He was influential in the administration of the colony during a time that coincided with the notorious Salem witch trials.
